member.name: T:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryClient
member.summary: Abstract class providing operations for Google Cloud BigQuery.

remarks.para: This abstract class is provided to enable testability while permitting additional operations to be added in the future. See and to construct instances; alternatively, you can construct a directly from a .
All instance methods declared in this class are virtual, with an implementation which simply throws . All these methods are overridden in .

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryClient.Service
member.summary: The underlying BigQuery service object used by this client.
member.remarks: The class only provides convenience operations built on top of an existing service object. Any more complex operations which are not supported by this wrapper may wish to use the same service object as the wrapper, in order to take advantage of its configuration (for authentication, application naming etc).

remarks.para: The dataset is first fetched to retrieve the current values, then a patch call is made.

member.param: The dataset ID. Must not be null.
The name of the label. Must not be null.
The new value of the label. Must not be null.
The options for the operation. May be null, in which case defaults will be supplied.
member.returns: The previous value of the label, or null if the label was not previously set.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryClient.ModifyDatasetLabels(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.ModifyLabelsOptions)
member.summary: Sets or removes one or more labels on the specified dataset within this client's project. This method just creates a and delegates to .
member.remarks: Each entry in is treated as a label to set or remove. If the value is null, it will be removed from the dataset; otherwise, it will be set/added. Labels which do not have an entry in the dictionary will be ignored.
member.param: The dataset ID. Must not be null.
The labels to set. Must contain at least one entry; keys must not be null, but values may be (indicating label removal).
The options for the operation. May be null, in which case defaults will be supplied.
member.returns: A dictionary with the same keys as , and values indicating the corresponding label value before this operation completed. Labels which weren't present on the dataset before the modification have corresponding null values in the returned dictionary.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryClient.UploadCsv(System.String,System.String,Google.Apis.Bigquery.v2.Data.TableSchema,System.IO.Stream,Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.UploadCsvOptions)
member.summary: Uploads a stream of CSV data to the specified table within this client's project. This method just creates a and delegates to .

remarks.para: The schema can come from three places: it can be specified by , it can be retrieved from the destination table if that already exists, or it can be inferred by the server. If is null and the of is not set to true, it is expected that the table already exists, and its schema is loaded automatically.

member.param: The dataset ID. Must not be null.
The table ID. Must not be null.
The schema of the data, or null for the schema to be loaded from the destination table or inferred (based on ).
The stream of input data. Must not be null.
The options for the operation. May be null, in which case defaults will be supplied.
member.returns: A data upload job.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryDataset.Update(Google.Apis.Bigquery.v2.Data.Dataset,Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.UpdateDatasetOptions)
member.summary: Updates this dataset to match the specified resource.
member.remarks: This method delegates to . A simple way of updating the dataset is to modify and then call this method with no arguments. This is convenient, but it's important to understand that modifying in this way leaves this object in an unusual state - it represents "the dataset as it was when fetched, but then modified locally". For example, the etag will be the original etag, rather than the one associated with the updated dataset. To avoid this causing confusion, we recommend only taking this approach if the object will not be used afterwards. Use the value returned by this method as the new, self-consistent representation of the dataset.
member.param: The resource to update with. If null, the property is used.
The options for the operation. May be null, in which case defaults will be supplied.
member.returns: The updated dataset.

member.summary: Patches this dataset with fields in the specified resource.
member.remarks: This method delegates to .
member.param: The resource to patch with. Must not be null.
If true, the etag from is propagated into for optimistic concurrency. Otherwise, is left unchanged.
The options for the operation. May be null, in which case defaults will be supplied.
member.returns: The updated dataset.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryDataset.UpdateAsync(Google.Apis.Bigquery.v2.Data.Dataset,Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.UpdateDatasetOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously updates this dataset to match the specified resource.
member.remarks: This method delegates to . A simple way of updating the dataset is to modify and then call this method with no arguments. This is convenient, but it's important to understand that modifying in this way leaves this object in an unusual state - it represents "the dataset as it was when fetched, but then modified locally". For example, the etag will be the original etag, rather than the one associated with the updated dataset. To avoid this causing confusion, we recommend only taking this approach if the object will not be used afterwards. Use the value returned by this method as the new, self-consistent representation of the dataset.
member.param: The resource to update with. If null, the property is used.
The options for the operation. May be null, in which case defaults will be supplied.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. When complete, the result is the updated dataset.

member.remarks: This method delegates to .
member.param: The resource to patch with. Must not be null.

The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. When complete, the result is the updated dataset.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryInsertRow
member.summary: A row used for streaming data insertion.

remarks.para: This is effectively a dictionary where each key is the field name (a string) and the value is the corresponding value for that field. Supported value types:

item.description: Any IReadOnlyList<T> of one of the above types (for repeated fields). This includes arrays and List<T> values.

remarks.para: Note that all integer types are stored as System.Int64, and all floating point types are stored as System.Double.

DateTimeOffset values are converted to UTC and treated as timestamp. The handling of DateTime values depends on the Kind: values with a Kind of Local are rejected; values with a Kind of UTC are treated as timestamps; values with a Kind of Unspecified are treated as civil datetime values. All values are stored with a precision of a microsecond.
TimeSpan values must be non-negative and less than 24 hours, used to represent a time-of-day.
Although date values are retrieved as System.DateTime, they must be inserted as string values, in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
is used for record/struct fields for convenience, but only the of the top-level row is relevant.

Null elements within repeated fields are prohibited. This is validated client-side when the row is inserted; validating when a value is added to the row would be ineffective as the values could change before insertion.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryInsertRow.InsertId
member.summary: To help ensure data consistency, you can supply an for each inserted row. BigQuery remembers this ID for at least one minute. If you try to stream the same set of rows within that time period and the insertId property is set, BigQuery uses the property to de-duplicate your data on a best effort basis.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryParameter
member.summary: A parameter within the of a .

remarks.para: Each parameter has a name, type and value. Names are irrelevant for queries using positional parameters. All scalar types are converted into strings before being passed to the server, but the nature of the conversion depends on the specified type.

The following list shows the correspondence between the parameter type and valid value types. All scalar types may be specified as a string value, which will not be validated or converted on the client, but passed to the API as-is.

item.description: Int64: System.Int16, System.Int32, System.Int64, System.UInt16, System.UInt32, System.UInt64
Float64: Any type valid for Int64, as well as System.Single and System.Double
Array: An IReadOnlyList<T> of any of the above types corresponding to the , which will be inferred from the value's element type if not otherwise specified.

remarks.para: If the parameter type is null, it is inferred from the value. A value is always assumed to be a , a value is always assumed to be a , and a value is assumed to be regardless of its .
If an array parameter doesn't specify the array type, the type is inferred from the type of the value.
Array parameters must not have a value of null, and all the elements must be non-null as well.
If a value is provided for a parameter, the value must have a of .
Struct parameters are currently not supported.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryTable.Update(Google.Apis.Bigquery.v2.Data.Table,Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.UpdateTableOptions)
member.summary: Updates this table to match the specified resource.
member.remarks: This method delegates to . A simple way of updating the table is to modify and then call this method with no arguments. This is convenient, but it's important to understand that modifying in this way leaves this object in an unusual state - it represents "the table as it was when fetched, but then modified locally". For example, the etag will be the original etag, rather than the one associated with the updated table. To avoid this causing confusion, we recommend only taking this approach if the object will not be used afterwards. Use the value returned by this method as the new, self-consistent representation of the table.
member.param: The resource to update with. If null, the property is used.
The options for the operation. May be null, in which case defaults will be supplied.
member.returns: The updated table.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryTable.Patch(Google.Apis.Bigquery.v2.Data.Table,System.Boolean,Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.PatchTableOptions)
member.summary: Patches this table with fields in the specified resource.
member.remarks: This method delegates to .
member.param: The resource to patch with. Must not be null.
If true, the etag from is propagated into for optimistic concurrency. Otherwise, is left unchanged.
The options for the operation. May be null, in which case defaults will be supplied.
member.returns: The updated table.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryTable.ToLegacySqlFormat
member.summary: Returns the fully-qualified ID of the table in Legacy SQL format. The Legacy SQL format uses square brackets instead of backticks to surround the ID, and uses a colon instead of a period between the project ID and the dataset ID.
member.returns: The fully-qualified ID of the table in Legacy SQL format.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryTable.ToString
member.summary: Returns the fully-qualified ID of the table in backticks.

remarks.para: This is designed to facilitate constructing queries by simply including the table in the string.

example.code: var table = client.GetTable(datasetId, tableId); var query = $"SELECT name, age from {table}";

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.BigQueryTable.ToString(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Returns the fully-qualified ID of the table, in either the Standard SQL or Legacy SQL format.

remarks.para: This method allows the Legacy SQL format to be used simply within an interpolated string.

example.code: var table = client.GetTable(datasetId, tableId); var query = $"SELECT name, age from {table:legacy}";

member.param: If this has a value of "legacy", the Legacy SQL format is used; otherwise, the Standard SQL format is used.
Ignored.
member.returns: The formatted table name.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.CreateLoadJobOptions.CreateDisposition
member.summary: Specifies whether the operation is allowed to create new tables. If not set, this is effectively .

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.CreateLoadJobOptions.WriteDisposition
member.summary: Specifies the behavior if the destination table exists and is non-empty. If not set, this is effectively .

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.CreateLoadJobOptions.Autodetect
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the options and schema for CSV and JSON sources should automatically be inferred.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.CreateLoadJobOptions.NullMarker
member.summary: Specifies a string that represents a null value in a CSV file. For example, if you specify "\N", BigQuery interprets "\N" as a null value when loading a CSV file. The default value is the empty string. If you set this property to a custom value, BigQuery throws an error if an empty string is present for all data types except for STRING and BYTE. For STRING and BYTE columns, BigQuery interprets the empty string as an empty value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.CreateLoadJobOptions.ProjectionFields
member.summary: If sourceFormat is set to , indicates which entity properties to load into BigQuery from a Cloud Datastore backup. Property names are case sensitive and must be top-level properties. If no properties are specified, BigQuery loads all properties. If any named property isn't found in the Cloud Datastore backup, an invalid error is returned in the job result.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.ModifyLabelsOptions
member.summary: Options used when modifying labels.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.ModifyLabelsOptions.DefaultRetries
member.summary: The default number of retries.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.ModifyLabelsOptions.ETag
member.summary: Precondition for modification: the labels are only modified if its current etag matches the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.ModifyLabelsOptions.Retries
member.summary: The number of times to retry the modification if the etag changes in the read/modify/write cycle. If this property is not set, a suitable default is used. The value must not be negative.
member.remarks: Modifying labels involves reading the resource in one request, then sending another request with the new labels, including an etag check to ensure that the dataset hasn't changed between the two requests. If the etag *has* changed, the overall operation can be retried from the start. This property indicates the number of retries, so it has a minimum value of 0.

member.summary: Flattens all nested and repeated fields in the query results. If not set, this is effectively true. If this is set to false, must be specified and must be set to true.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.QueryOptions.MaximumBillingTier
member.summary: Limits the billing tier of the job. If the query uses resources beyond this tier, it will fail. If not set, this is effectively the project default.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.QueryOptions.MaximumBytesBilled
member.summary: Limits the bytes billed for this job. Queries that will have bytes billed beyond this limit will fail (without incurring a charge). If not set, this is effectively the project default.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.QueryOptions.Priority
member.summary: The priority of the query.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.QueryOptions.UseLegacySql
member.summary: Set to true to use legacy SQL instead of standard SQL.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.QueryOptions.DryRun
member.summary: If set to true, don't actually run this job. A valid query will return a mostly empty response with some processing statistics, while an invalid query will return the same error it would if it wasn't a dry run. This option can be used to determine the schema of the query without running it. The resulting has no job ID, so cannot be polled for completion, but the contains all the information returned by the server.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2.QueryOptions.ParameterMode
member.summary: If set, determines whether parameters are named or positional. If not set, this will default to named parameters. When named parameters are used, all parameters must have a name. When positional parameters are used, parameters may still have names, but don't have to.
member.remarks: This property is not used by the legacy query overloads using .

member.summary: The query is queued until idle resources are available.
